title: proposal: Allow relative import for internal packages.
body:
I understand and agree with the merits of not allowing
relative import in general (libraries specially).

Yet still, there are times that a package is only ever
used for a given project and now with `internal` support
with go tools, this assumption can _hard_  enforced.

Enter cloning.

I use Go everyday to build nimble micro-services that are
vaguely similar but often have changing elements, having to
rewrite the import paths every time I clone or fork a project
is pretty tedious and error prone

It would be nice if packages under internal could be relatively
imported.

For example,
for packages under `$GOPATH/project` including itself, allow importing of
`$GOPATH/project/internal/user` as `internal/user`
`$GOPATH/project/internal/user/acl` as `internal/user/acl`.
